data.name: kstidUnableToOpenProjectCaption
data.comment: Caption for Unable to Open Project dialog box

data.name: ksMovingProjectsCaption
data.comment: Must contain {0} and {1}, two directory paths

data.name: ksRestoringOldFwBackupFailed
data.value: Restoring from an old FieldWorks backup failed.

data.name: kstidUnableToOpenLastProject
data.value: The last time {0} started, it stopped responding when attempting to open the FieldWorks project: {1}
data.comment: Message shown on the Unable to Open Project dialog box when FieldWorks previously crashed on startup

data.name: kstidLoadingProject
data.comment: Splash screen message

data.name: kstidCacheInitFailure
data.comment: Message shown on the Unable to Open Project dialog box when the cache cannot be initialized.

data.name: kstidOtherApplicationHasDialog
data.value: {0} cannot open project {1} because a dialog box is open in {2}. Close any dialog boxes in {2} to continue.
data.comment: Message shown when TE or FLEx is started when the other application has an open modal dialog box.

data.name: ksYouCanTryToMoveProjects
data.value: You can try to move the projects to the new location yourself in Windows Explorer.

data.name: ksWelcomeDialogCheckboxText
data.value: When I start {0}, always open the last edited project automatically.
data.comment: {0} will be either Language Explorer or Translation Editor

data.name: kstidOtherApplicationBusy
data.value: {0} cannot open project {1} because {2} is busy. If you wait until {2} has finished, {0} will continue.
data.comment: Message shown when TE or FLEx is started when the other application is doing something that can't be interrupted.

data.name: kstidStartupProblem
data.comment: Caption that goes with kstidFieldWorksDidNotRespond.

data.name: ksErrorMigratingProjects
data.value: An error occurred trying to migrate existing projects from an older version of FieldWorks:

data.name: ksDoYouWantToMigrate
data.value: Do you want to migrate existing projects from an older version of FieldWorks?

data.name: ksCannotMoveProjects
data.value: FieldWorks is unable to move the following projects to the new location.

data.name: ksProjectLinksStillOld
data.value: The files this project links to are currently still located in the old FieldWorks folder. Would you like to store those files in the new folder for this project?

data.name: ksChangeProjectLocationFailedDetails
data.value: The attempt to change the location of the projects folder has failed. This is usually because you do not have administrator privileges in this account (or you answered 'no' when asked whether it was OK to make changes to your machine). Because the project folder location affects all users of this computer, administrator privilege is required to change it.

data.name: kstidSaving
data.comment: Splash screen message when changes made during application initialization are being saved

data.name: kstidFieldWorksDidNotRespond
data.value: Another instance of FieldWorks appears to be running, but did not respond properly to a request from this one. This is a bug; please report it to FlexErrors@sil.org. We recommend that you shut down all FieldWorks applications and try again. If you still get this message, restart your computer. (Experts may also try to recover by killing any FieldWorks processes using TaskManager.) Do you want to Retry now?
data.comment: Message reporting a bug when a second instance of FieldWorks tries to check whether another one is open on the same project.

data.name: ksNotifyWsRemoved
data.value: FieldWorks found one or more invalid writing systems while loading the project. FieldWorks has safely removed the writing system(s) from the list.{0}{0}Writing systems removed:{0}{1}

data.name: ksMovingProject
data.comment: Must contain {0}, the project name

data.name: ksBackupErrorDuringRestore
data.value: Do you want to continue with the restore?

data.name: kstidFieldWorksRespondedNotSure
data.value: Another instance of FieldWorks appears to be starting up at the same time as this one, and things have gotten confused. We recommend letting one project open fully before you try to open another one. If you get this message repeatedly or when not trying to open two projects at once, you may have encountered a bug; please report it. It may help to restart your computer.

data.name: kstidFallbackToEnglishUi
data.value: User interface language '{0}' is not supported. Continue using English as the user interface language?
data.comment: Message displayed when the UI locale the user previously selected is no supported.

data.name: ksReviewLocationOfLinkedFiles
data.value: Review the location of Linked Files

data.name: kstidThisApplicationIsBusy
data.value: {0} is running but cannot open a window for project {1} because FieldWorks is busy. If you wait until FieldWorks has finished, {0} will continue.
data.comment: Message shown when TE or FLEx is started when the application already exists but can not be brought to the front because of a major change to the FieldWorks data.

data.name: ksHklmProblem
data.value:
FieldWorks is unable to start because some necessary Registry keys are missing or inaccessible. There should be a registry entry {0}.
We have sometimes seen cases where installing other software leaves the machine in a state where non-administrators cannot access these registry entries. If this is your problem, there is a possible workaround. Try a right click on the icon that you use to start FieldWorks and choose the option 'Run as Administrator' from the context menu. See whether that helps. It may be that it is now necessary for you to use that option every time you start FLEx.
We don't know why this happens. If you have any idea what recently changed on your computer to cause it, please pass this on to the developers.
data.comment: This message should never be seen. Some users however have gotten into a weird state we don't understand where they have to run-as-administrator in order to access required local-machine keys.

data.name: ksInvalidLinkedFilesFolder
data.value: {0} is not a valid directory for linked files. Please select a valid directory.
data.comment: Error message for accessing an invalid LangProject.LinkedFilesRootDir value

data.name: ksLinkedFilesFolder
data.comment: Caption for folder dialog, when setting a new LangProject.LinkedFilesRootDir value

data.name: AutomaticUpdatesMessage
data.value: Would you like FieldWorks to download updates automatically? (To configure update settings, go to Tools->Options->Updates.)
data.comment: Question asked on first launch. Options are Yes and No.

data.name: ksDeleteAndReportCorruptSettingsFile
data.value: FieldWorks has detected one or more corrupted settings files. These files will be safely deleted. If you have been using different keyboards to input text, these may be reset to default values. Please restore them yourself.
data.comment: Let users know that local user settings need to be manually restored

data.name: kstidOpenToAssociateFwProj
data.comment: Title for the Open Project Dialog when called from an external application to associate a FieldWorks project with that application

data.name: kstidCantMigrateWrongOS
data.value: You may be able to set up a virtual machine running Windows 7 or earlier and install FieldWorks there. On Windows 7 or earlier, this dialog will allow you to download some components that can migrate your project. Unfortunately these components are not directly supported on your operating system.

data.name: ksChooseProjectFolder
data.comment: label for folder chooser dialog

data.name: ksFindRelatedWords
data.comment: message box title

data.name: ksLexicallyRelatedWords
data.value: These words are lexically related to {0}:
data.comment: {0} is a vernacular word

data.name: ksNoEntriesWithSameSemanticDomain
data.value: Sorry, no other entries were found with the same semantic domain(s) as that entry.

data.name: ksNoSemanticDomainsListedForEntry
data.value: Sorry, no semantic domains are listed for any of the senses of that entry, and no lexical relations (or cross references) include that entry or any of its senses. Without these, we cannot find related entries.

data.name: kstidFindRelWordsNotInDict
data.value: Sorry, that entry is not yet in the dictionary

data.name: kstidFindRelWordsTitle
data.comment: Title for message box when Find Related Words can't find any related words

data.name: ksWordsRelatedBySemanticDomain
data.value: Words related by semantic domain to {0}:
data.comment: {0} is a vernacular word
